I know there is always a little chance it is cancer but thank you for saying at least that the chance, according to my age and bilaterality, it is unlikely. Still I'm going to see the doctor after these 2 weeks for sure and keep a watchful eye on any changes.

Posts.Content: May 7, 2017 04:43AM lubosazor wrote: My student health service is, figuratively said, a myth, I heard of it but no one knows if it really exists... The campus is rather small and the collage buildings are spread in the city.  Well not to ease my state, before I went back to collage, like 2 weeks ago when I was home, I was diagnosed with GERD, so I'm on PPIs and diet. So no coffee or tea with higher caffeine content for me... (among other things) To complete my state I was also on ultrasound back home and they found some kind of little thickening on my little intestine, near my belly button, no one yet explained what it is.  I know I'm going off topic... but you can imagine how I felt when I found these additional lumps in my breast. Why at this point of my life when I need to concentrate the most... Well all I can do is to try and keep a cool head about all this and have multitude of medical examinations after my state exams (no celebrations for me either).
